Articles.Content: So, I've played since KSP 0.22, but I havent been playing lately. So, I just saw that one of my favorite youtubers (Jacksepticeye) make another KSP video. However, he said it is now a full release. He made a plane using SRBs, but a few seconds after the reentry effects appeared, stuff started exploding. Is there reentry damage now?

Yes, there is! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) It certainly adds a level of difficulty, but it also makes the reentry more realistic/interesting (i.e. you can't slam into the atmosphere at 6 km/s and expect to be unscathed.) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) There is also a slider that lets players adjust the amount of heat, if you find it too difficult.
where is the slider you speak of? since there is total loss of control on reentry (flipping to nose first no matter what you do) I want to turn it off until its fixed.
There is a waymto fix that, and the slider is lacated in the difficulty options when starting a new save.

Indeed, reentry heating and thermal physics are now implemented in the Stock game. Careful with those LV-Ns! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Welcome onboard!
